  • Constructor Details

    • Phoneme

      public Phoneme(Arpabet phoneme, int stress)
      Constructor to instantiate the phoneme class
      Parameters:
      phoneme - stores the arpabet constant to represent a sound.
      stress - stores the stress value to indicate stress level.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either the phoneme and stress values are invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getArpabet

      public Arpabet getArpabet()
      Gets the phoneme's arpabet constant.
      Specified by:
      getArpabet in interface IPhoneme
      Returns:
      arpabet from the phoneme attribute.

    • getStress

      public int getStress()
      Gets the stress value.
      Specified by:
      getStress in interface IPhoneme
      Returns:
      stress value from the stress attribute.

    • hasSameArpabet

      public boolean hasSameArpabet(IPhoneme other)
      Checks if the passed phoneme has the same arpabet current phoneme object.
      Specified by:
      hasSameArpabet in interface IPhoneme
      Parameters:
      other - passed phoneme in order to have access to its arpabet constant.
      Returns:
      true if both phonemes has the same arpabet, else returns false.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the passed phoneme is null.

    • isPhonemeValid

      public boolean isPhonemeValid()
      Checks if the passed phoneme is not null.
      Returns:
      true if passed phoneme is not null.

    • isStressValueValid

      public boolean isStressValueValid()
      Checks if the stress value is valid
      Returns:
      true if the stress value is either being -1, 0, 1 or 2, else returns false.

    • isVowelPhonemeStressValueValid

      public boolean isVowelPhonemeStressValueValid()
      Checks if the vowel's stress value is valid.
      Returns:
      true if the stress value is not -1.

    • isNonVowelPhonemeStressValueValid

      public boolean isNonVowelPhonemeStressValueValid()
      Checks if the non-vowel stress value is -1.
      Returns:
      true if the stress value is -1.
